description: From Portuguese jaboticaba (also spelt jabuticaba), from Tupian yawoti’kawa (“jaboticaba fruit”) or ïapoti’kaba (“fruit in bloom”).

entries.meaning: The evergreen Brazilian grape tree, Myrciaria cauliflora, a fruit-bearing tree native to Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay.
Its fruit, purplish-black with a white pulp, which can be eaten raw or used in jellies and drinks.
